content:
The MOF-808 was prepared by the method previously reported. Specifically, the ZrOCl2·8H2O (121.5 mg, 0.38 mmol) and trimesic acid (53 mg, 0.25 mmol) were mixed into 1:1 DMF/formic acid (11.5 mL, v/v) and stirred until the solid was completely dissolved. Afterward, the solution was transferred into a Teflon-lined autoclave and heated at 403 K for 48 h. When cooling to room temperature, the solid was centrifuged and soaked with DMF and ethanol for three days (changing solvents daily). The product was vacuum-dried at 333 K and stored in the dryer.

Fabrication of Hybrid Membranes

The hybrid membranes were prepared by a solution-casting method (). The PAMPS (1 g, 10 wt %) solution was added into the 2 wt % PVA solution (10 g) to obtain the PVA/PAMPS (PP) solution as a polymeric matrix. Subsequently, a certain amount of as-prepared HBABSA@MOF-808 was suspended in 4 mL of distilled water under ultrasonic treatment for 30 min. The above suspension was dropwise added into the PVA/PAMPS solution. After stirring for 10 min, 1 wt % GA aqueous solution (1 mL) was added to the mixed solution for cross-linking and kept under stirring for 24 h at room temperature. Before casting the membranes, the mixed solution was placed at 333 K for 4 h to eliminate the bubbles in the solution and then evenly poured into the polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE) mold and dried in a draught-drying cabinet without wind at 333 K for 24 h to form hybrid membranes, which were denoted as HBABSA@MOF-808/PP-X where X (X = 5, 10, 15, 20 and 25) was the proportion of HBABSA@MOF-808 added into the hybrid membranes.
clean_text:
Synthesis of MOF-808

The MOF-808 was prepared by the method previously reported. Specifically, the ZrOCl2⋅8H2O (121.5 mg, 0.38 mmol) and trimesic acid (53 mg, 0.25 mmol) were mixed into 1:1 DMF/formic acid (11.5 mL, v/v) and stirred until the solid was completely dissolved. Afterward, the solution was transferred into a Teflon-lined autoclave and heated at 403 K for 48 h. When cooling to room temperature, the solid was centrifuged and soaked with DMF and ethanol for three days (changing solvents daily). The product was vacuum-dried at 333 K and stored in the dryer.

Fabrication of Hybrid Membranes

The hybrid membranes were prepared by a solution-casting method (). The PAMPS (1 g, 10 wt %) solution was added into the 2 wt % PVA solution (10 g) to obtain the PVA/PAMPS (PP) solution as a polymeric matrix. Subsequently, a certain amount of as-prepared HBABSA@MOF-808 was suspended in 4 mL of distilled water under ultrasonic treatment for 30 min. The above suspension was dropwise added into the PVA/PAMPS solution. After stirring for 10 min, 1 wt % GA aqueous solution (1 mL) was added to the mixed solution for cross-linking and kept under stirring for 24 h at room temperature. Before casting the membranes, the mixed solution was placed at 333 K for 4 h to eliminate the bubbles in the solution and then evenly poured into the polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE) mold and dried in a draught-drying cabinet without wind at 333 K for 24 h to form hybrid membranes, which were denoted as HBABSA@MOF-808/PP-X where X (X = 5, 10, 15, 20 and 25) was the proportion of HBABSA@MOF-808 added into the hybrid membranes.
